item.title: Alana add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "The soul is healed by being with children." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Alana add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Grown-ups never understand anything by themselves, and it is tiresome for children to be always and forever explaining things to them" -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Alana add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Children must be taught how to think, not what to think." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Alana add a quote by Fred Rogers (Mr. Rogers)
item.description: "Anyone who does anything to help a child in his life is a hero to me. " -- Fred Rogers (Mr. Rogers)

item.title: Alana add a quote by His Holiness the Dahai Lama
item.description: "Look at children. Of course they may quarrel, but generally speaking they do not harbor ill feelings as much or as long as adults do. Most adults have the advantage of education over children, but what is the use of an education if they show a big smile while hiding negative feelings deep inside? Children dont usually act in such a manner. If they feel angry with someone, they express it, and then it is finished. They can still play with that person the following day." -- His Holiness the Dahai Lama

item.title: Alana add a quote by Ursula Hegi
item.description: "That's the nature of being a parent, Sabine has discovered. You'll love your children far more than you ever loved your parents, and -- in the recognition that your own children cannot fathom the depth of your love -- you come to understand the tragic, unrequited love of your own parents." -- Ursula Hegi

item.title: Alana add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Your children are not your children. They are the sons and daughters of Life's longing for itself... You may house their bodies but not their souls, for their souls dwell in the house of tomorrow, which you cannot visit, not even in your dreams." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Alana add a quote by Debra Ginsberg
item.description: "Through the blur, I wondered if I was alone or if other parents felt the same way I did - that everything involving our children was painful in some way. The emotions, whether they were joy, sorrow, love or pride, were so deep and sharp that in the end they left you raw, exposed and yes, in pain. The human heart was not designed to beat outside the human body and yet, each child represented just that - a parent's heart bared, beating forever outside its chest." -- Debra Ginsberg

item.title: Alana add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "I don't remember who said this, but there really are places in the heart you don't even know exist until you love a child." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Alana add a quote by Angela Schwindt
item.description: "While we try to teach our children all about life, our children teach us what life is all about." -- Angela Schwindt

item.title: Alana add a quote by Craig Ferguson
item.description: "I think when you become a parent you go from being a star in the movie of your own life to the supporting player in the movie of someone else's." -- Craig Ferguson

item.title: Alana add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description:
"The Voice
There is a voice inside of you That whispers all day long, "I feel this is right for me, I know that this is wrong." No teacher, preacher, parent, friend Or wise man can decide What's right for you--just listen to The voice that speaks inside." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Alana add a quote by William Glasser
item.description: "When you study great teachers... you will learn much more from their caring and hard work than from their style." -- William Glasser

item.title: Alana add a quote by Karl Menninger
item.description: "What the teacher is, is more important than what he teaches." -- Karl Menninger

item.title: Alana add a quote by Neal Shusterman
item.description: "Once in a while our school has half days, and the teachers spend the afternoon 'in service,' which I think must be a group therapy for having to deal with us." -- Neal Shusterman

item.title: Alana add a quote by Steve Maraboli
item.description: "The world gives us PLENTY of opportunities to strengthen our patience. While this truth can definitely be challenging, this is a good thing. Patience is a key that unlocks the door to a more fulfilling life. It is through a cultivation of patience that we become better parents, powerful teachers, great businessmen, good friends, and a live a happier life." -- Steve Maraboli

item.title: Alana add a quote by Emily Byrd Starr
item.description: "I once heard a saying that when you're ready, the teacher you need appears before you." -- Emily Byrd Starr

item.title: Alana add a quote by Pat Conroy
item.description: "The great teachers fill you up with hope and shower you with a thousand reasons to embrace all aspects of life. I wanted to follow Mr. Monte around for the rest of my life, learning everything he wished to share of impart, but I didn't know how to ask." -- Pat Conroy

item.title: Alana add a quote by Allan Lokos
item.description: "True patience is grounded in wisdom & compassion." -- Allan Lokos

item.title: Alana add a quote by Eric Micha'el Leventhal
item.description: "Our children are only as brilliant as we allow them to be." -- Eric Micha'el Leventhal
